name: Camp Nou (Barcelona)
desc: Europe's largest stadium, home of FC Barcelona and countless dramatic matches.

name: Wembley Stadium (London)
desc: The center of English football tradition and monumental finals.

name: Santiago Bernabéu (Madrid)
desc: Real Madrid’s iconic fortress in the heart of the Spanish capital.

name: Maracanã (Rio de Janeiro)
desc: Brazil’s football temple, host to World Cup and legendary finals.

name: San Siro (Milan)
desc: Shared by AC Milan and Inter, roaring with passion every derby.

name: Signal Iduna Park (Dortmund)
desc: Germany’s famous Yellow Wall and an electrifying atmosphere.

name: Old Trafford (Manchester)
desc: Home to Manchester United, stands for English football greatness.

name: Allianz Arena (Munich)
desc: Striking with its luminous facade, home to Bayern Munich.

name: Anfield (Liverpool)
desc: ‘You’ll Never Walk Alone’ echoes on European nights.

name: Stade de France (Paris)
desc: France’s grand stage for international triumph and celebration.

name: Estádio da Luz (Lisbon)
desc: Home of Benfica, the ‘Stadium of Light’ shines in Portugal.

name: Metropolitano (Madrid)
desc: Atletico Madrid’s state-of-the-art red and white cauldron.

name: Stadio Olimpico (Rome)
desc: Historic ground and stage for Lazio, Roma, and Italy.

name: Estádio do Dragão (Porto)
desc: Fortress of FC Porto, blue passion roars here.

name: La Bombonera (Buenos Aires)
desc: The blue-and-yellow heart of Boca Juniors and Argentinian football.

name: Azteca Stadium (Mexico City)
desc: Legendary Mexican stadium, site of 'Hand of God' and World Cup glory.

name: St. James' Park (Newcastle)
desc: Northern fortress with electric Toon Army spirit.

name: Celtic Park (Glasgow)
desc: The home of the Hoops. ‘Paradise’ for Celtic FC faithful.

name: Emirates Stadium (London)
desc: Arsenal’s modern home in North London.

name: Tottenham Hotspur Stadium (London)
desc: Spurs digital-age fortress, built to host world football and NFL.

name: Parc des Princes (Paris)
desc: Paris Saint-Germain’s playground and capital venue.

name: Estadio Monumental (Buenos Aires)
desc: River Plate’s historic home and Argentina’s biggest stadium.

name: Itaipava Arena Fonte Nova (Salvador)
desc: Brazil’s Bahia decorated venue, rebuilt for World Cup 2014.

name: Friends Arena (Stockholm)
desc: Sweden’s national stadium. Modern, multi-purpose and massive.

name: Amsterdam ArenA (Johan Cruyff Arena)
desc: Ajax’s home, named after the Dutch legend himself.

name: Estádio Mineirão (Belo Horizonte)
desc: Historic Brazilian stadium; hosted World Cup heartbreak and elation.

name: King Fahd International Stadium (Riyadh)
desc: Spectacular tent-roofed jewel in the Saudi desert.

name: Estadio Centenario (Montevideo)
desc: The original World Cup final stadium (1930), South America's shrine.

name: Estadio Nacional Mane Garrincha (Brasilia)
desc: Brazil's modernist gem with unique colonnade design.

name: Croke Park (Dublin)
desc: Ireland's spiritual home for GAA and football.

name: Luzhniki Stadium (Moscow)
desc: Hosts major Russian and European finals, renovated for World Cup 2018.
